sen.e: This is plainly shown in facts that unlike shugo daimyo, Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period) basically lived locally, and individual lord enforced law in their own domain, spreading it, and that they aimed encouragement of new industry such as mine development and maintenance of agricultural water, and the policy of fortifying the country, strengthening the military.
